overtake.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to go past a moving vehicle or person because you are going faster than them and want to get in front of them
overtake.translation[0].definitions[0].e: He pulled out to overtake the van.
Never try to overtake on a bend.
overtake.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to develop or increase more quickly than someone or something else and become more successful, more important, or more advanced than them
overtake.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Television soon overtook the cinema as the most popular form of entertainment.
Hingis has now overtaken her in the world tennis rankings.
overtake.translation[0].definitions[2].d: if something bad, especially a feeling, overtakes you, it happens to you suddenly and has a strong effect on you
overtake.translation[0].definitions[2].e: A terrible sense of panic overtook him.
She was overtaken by emotion and started to cry.
